DataElement.preferredName: Autoimmune Disease Intervention Required Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical trial participation, as outlined in the study protocol, that address the mandatory intervention(s) to improve health or to alter the course of autoimmune disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Autoimmune Disease Intervention Required Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them._A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

Property.preferredName: Intervention Required Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have autoimmune
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in past 2 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in past 2 years (i.e., use of disease modifying agents, corticosteroids, or immunosuppressive drugs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease requiring systemic corticosteroids greater than the equivalent of prednisone 10 mg daily including but not limited to: systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, colitis, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjögren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barré syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past two years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease, except for patients with hypothyroidism and vitiligo, that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years (i.e., with use of disease modifying agents, corticosteroids or immunosuppressive drugs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years (i.e., with use of disease modifying agents, corticosteroids or immunosuppressive drugs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has autoimmune hyperthyroid disease is the patient not requiring immunosuppressive treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of autoimmune disease (such as autoimmune thyroid disease or inflammatory bowel disease) that has required systemic treatment within 2 years prior to initiation of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease that has required systemic immunosuppressive medication within the previous 3 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an ongoing treatment with systemic steroids at dose equivalent to greater than prednisone 10 mg daily or other immunosuppressive medication within 7 days of initiation of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received immunosuppressive treatment for systemic autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjögren's syndrome, multiple sclerosis, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis within the last 2 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease, except for hypothyroidism and vitiligo, that has required systemic treatment in past 2 years (i.e., use of disease modifying agents, corticosteroids, or immunosuppressive drugs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within the past 3 months or a documented history of clinically severe autoimmune disease, or a syndrome that requires systemic steroids or immunosuppressive agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has more than one autoimmune disease, has the treating physician determined which autoimmune disease is dominant for the patient to be treated under that specific cohort?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years (i.e., with use of disease modifying agents, corticosteroids, or immunosuppressive drugs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active underlying autoimmune disease requiring systemic immunosuppressive medication (oral prednisone greater than 10 mg/day or equivalent)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment within 2 years prior to registration (i.e., with use of disease modifying agents, corticosteroids, or immunosuppressive drugs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a condition requiring systemic treatment with either corticosteroids (greater than 10 mg daily prednisone equivalents) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had an active autoimmune disease in the past 2 years that has required systemic treatment (i.e., with use of disease-modifying agents, corticosteroids, or immunosuppressive agents)?

DataElement.changeDescription: 2020-8-4 AQT added for P10398. AK 12/5/17 tt approved and release/MD. 11/29/17 tt/10100.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.11.3 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0003032. ak 8/4/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
